cot.content:
To solve the problem, Please think and reason step by step, then answer.
question:
who does the voice of marceline on adventure time
        
Generation Format:
Reasoning process:
Answer:

Reasoning process: To answer the question, I need to identify the character Marceline from the animated series "Adventure Time" and determine who provides her voice. Marceline is a prominent character known for her musical talent and unique personality. I recall that the show features a variety of voice actors, and I need to pinpoint the specific actress who voices Marceline.

After considering the cast of "Adventure Time," I remember that the character of Marceline the Vampire Queen is voiced by a well-known actress and musician. I will confirm her name to ensure accuracy.

Answer: Marceline is voiced by Olivia Olson.

anchoring.content:
You are a cognitive scientist, to answer the following question:
who does the voice of marceline on adventure time
I will provide you with several retrieved passages:
Passages:
['Marceline is voiced by Olivia Olson. When production on "Adventure Time" began, Ward contacted his friend Martin Olson, who was a writer on the animated Disney series "Phineas and Ferb", and asked if he knew who played the character Vanessa Doofenshmirtz on "Phineas and Ferb", as he wanted "her as a voice" on his show; reportedly, Ward was unaware that the actress was actually Martin Olson\'s daughter. During the casting audition, Olivia Olson first read for Princess Bubblegum, but was later asked to read for the role of Marceline. Upon seeing character designs, Olson was "definitely impressed by the character". Because Ward knew that he wanted Olivia on his show, Martin Olson later joked that her audition was simply a "sham" to please network executives. In order to get into character, Olson often dresses in a manner similar to Marceline when she records her lines; she explained, "I always find ... that on the days that I go in to record Marceline, I\'ll dress like her, in a weird way ... I\'ll throw on some rock n\' roll boots, maybe some red lipstick, and just go in there." In flashback sequences, younger Marceline is voiced by Ava Acres. In the fifth season episodes "Finn the Human" / "Jake the Dog", an older, alternate universe version of the character is voiced by Cloris Leachman. Martin Olson also provides the voice for Marceline\'s demonic father Hunson Abadeer. Olivia Olson later noted that the opportunity to voice act with her father was "pretty cool".\n', 'Marceline is voiced by Olivia Olson; she had originally auditioned for the role of Princess Bubblegum. After her initial audition, she was asked to read for the role of Marcelline, and was "definitely impressed by the character" after seeing design drawings. Olson is also the character\'s singing voice. The artistic design for Marceline was created by Ward, with small changes and additions added by Phil Rynda, former lead character designer and prop designer for "Adventure Time". Olson later related in an interview that she was impressed by her character because, "she has really cool style […] I love what they come up with [in] every episode." The episode also features the vocal talents of actor Erik Estrada as King Worm; Estrada would reprise the role for the eponymous fourth season episode "King Worm".\n', 'BULLET::::- Olivia Olson, young actress voice of Marceline on "Adventure Time"\n', 'Marceline the Vampire Queen is a fictional character in the American animated Cartoon Network television series "Adventure Time", created by Pendleton Ward. She is voiced by Olivia Olson in most appearances, by Ava Acres as a child and by Cloris Leachman as an old woman. Marceline is a fun-loving 1,000-year-old vampire queen, as well as a musician who plays an electric bass that she made from her family\'s heirloom battle-axe. The artistic design for Marceline was created by Ward, with small changes and additions added by Phil Rynda, former lead character and prop designer for "Adventure Time".\n', 'BULLET::::- "Adventure Time" – Gridface Princess, Additional voices\n', 'In the American version, Olivia Olson, who is widely known as the voice of Marceline the Vampire Queen in "Adventure Time", voiced the character. South African musician Toya Delazy who is one of the many actors voicing the character in different countries expressed that she was intrigued by the character and felt a connection to her due to their similar backgrounds, as Delazy explained that she too missed out on getting to know her three sisters due to being estranged from her father for many years. Alesha Dixon who voiced Bliss for the British version expressed that she was beyond excited about her role and loved voicing character but that it was a hard job, explaining that this was due to the characters feisty personality and the fact that she had to do a lot of screaming while voicing her. She also stated that she watched the episode with her daughter Azura when it aired and that her daughter recognized her as the character. In the Arabic version the Fourth Powerpuff Girl is voiced by Nancy Ajram, a prominent Lebanese singer.\n', 'Reeve provided the bass guitar sound for the character Marceline the Vampire Queen in the Cartoon Network show Adventure Time.\n', 'BULLET::::- "Adventure Time" - voice of Bryce (2015-2017)\n', 'In June 2015, Moe along with rapper Open Mike Eagle, launched "Conversation Parade", a podcast in which the two discuss the Cartoon Network animated series "Adventure Time". The podcast has featured guests like Jeremy Shada (the voice of Finn the Human), John DiMaggio (the voice of Jake the Dog), Hynden Walch (the voice of Princess Bubblegum), Adam Muto (the series\' co-executive producer and showrunner), Kent Osborne ("Adventure Time"s head writer), Niki Yang (the voice of BMO and Lady Rainicorn), Olivia Olson (the voice of Marceline), Jesse Moynihan (former storyboard artist), Jessica DiCicco (the voice of Flame Princess), Elizabeth Ito (one of the show\'s supervising directors), and alternative country musician Neko Case.\n', 'BULLET::::- Jeremy Shada, voice actor ("Adventure Time")\n']

South African musician Toya Delazy who is one of the many actors voicing the character in different countries expressed that she was intrigued by the character and felt a connection to her due to their similar backgrounds, as Delazy explained that she too missed out on getting to know her three sisters due to being estranged from her father for many years. Alesha Dixon who voiced Bliss for the British version expressed that she was beyond excited about her role and loved voicing character but that it was a hard job, explaining that this was due to the characters feisty personality and the fact that she had to do a lot of screaming while voicing her. She also stated that she watched the episode with her daughter Azura when it aired and that her daughter recognized her as the character. In the Arabic version the Fourth Powerpuff Girl is voiced by Nancy Ajram, a prominent Lebanese singer.
', 'Reeve provided the bass guitar sound for the character Marceline the Vampire Queen in the Cartoon Network show Adventure Time.
', 'BULLET::::- "Adventure Time" - voice of Bryce (2015-2017)
', 'In June 2015, Moe along with rapper Open Mike Eagle, launched "Conversation Parade", a podcast in which the two discuss the Cartoon Network animated series "Adventure Time". The podcast has featured guests like Jeremy Shada (the voice of Finn the Human), John DiMaggio (the voice of Jake the Dog), Hynden Walch (the voice of Princess Bubblegum), Adam Muto (the series' co-executive producer and showrunner), Kent Osborne ("Adventure Time"s head writer), Niki Yang (the voice of BMO and Lady Rainicorn), Olivia Olson (the voice of Marceline), Jesse Moynihan (former storyboard artist), Jessica DiCicco (the voice of Flame Princess), Elizabeth Ito (one of the show's supervising directors), and alternative country musician Neko Case.
', 'BULLET::::- Jeremy Shada, voice actor ("Adventure Time")
']

2. **Character Design and Impression**: Upon seeing the character designs for Marceline, Olson expressed that she was "definitely impressed by the character." This suggests that the visual representation of a character can influence an actor's connection to the role, which is an important aspect of character portrayal.

3. **Character Background**: Marceline is described as a 1,000-year-old vampire queen and a musician who plays an electric bass made from a family heirloom battle-axe. This background provides context for the character's personality and style, which can inform how Olson approaches voicing the character.

4. **Voice Acting Dynamics**: In addition to Olson, younger Marceline is voiced by Ava Acres, and an older version of the character is voiced by Cloris Leachman. This introduces the concept of voice acting across different ages and contexts, which can affect how the character is perceived by the audience.

5. **Personal Connection**: Olson has a personal connection to the character, as she often dresses in a manner similar to Marceline when recording her lines. This indicates that an actor's personal engagement with a character can enhance the authenticity of their performance.

6. **Collaboration with Family**: Martin Olson, Olivia's father, voices Marceline's father, Hunson Abadeer. This familial collaboration can create a unique dynamic in voice acting, potentially enriching the performance through shared experiences and emotional connections.

### Analysis of Impact on Causal Reasoning and Logical Inference:

The extracted information can improve the model's causal reasoning and logical inference capabilities in several ways:

- **Understanding Relationships**: By analyzing the relationships between casting decisions, character design, and actor engagement, the model can learn to infer how various factors influence outcomes in creative processes, such as voice acting.

- **Collaboration Dynamics**: The involvement of family members in voice acting can lead to unique performances that reflect shared histories, which the model can use to reason about the impact of collaborative dynamics in creative works.

Overall, the consolidation of this information provides a framework for the model to enhance its understanding of the complexities involved in voice acting and character development, thereby improving its causal reasoning and logical inference skills.

who does the voice of marceline on adventure time

Passages:
['Marceline is voiced by Olivia Olson. When production on "Adventure Time" began, Ward contacted his friend Martin Olson, who was a writer on the animated Disney series "Phineas and Ferb", and asked if he knew who played the character Vanessa Doofenshmirtz on "Phineas and Ferb", as he wanted "her as a voice" on his show; reportedly, Ward was unaware that the actress was actually Martin Olson\'s daughter. During the casting audition, Olivia Olson first read for Princess Bubblegum, but was later asked to read for the role of Marceline. Upon seeing character designs, Olson was "definitely impressed by the character". Because Ward knew that he wanted Olivia on his show, Martin Olson later joked that her audition was simply a "sham" to please network executives. In order to get into character, Olson often dresses in a manner similar to Marceline when she records her lines; she explained, "I always find ... that on the days that I go in to record Marceline, I\'ll dress like her, in a weird way ... I\'ll throw on some rock n\' roll boots, maybe some red lipstick, and just go in there." In flashback sequences, younger Marceline is voiced by Ava Acres. In the fifth season episodes "Finn the Human" / "Jake the Dog", an older, alternate universe version of the character is voiced by Cloris Leachman. Martin Olson also provides the voice for Marceline\'s demonic father Hunson Abadeer. Olivia Olson later noted that the opportunity to voice act with her father was "pretty cool".\n', 'Marceline is voiced by Olivia Olson; she had originally auditioned for the role of Princess Bubblegum. After her initial audition, she was asked to read for the role of Marcelline, and was "definitely impressed by the character" after seeing design drawings. Olson is also the character\'s singing voice. The artistic design for Marceline was created by Ward, with small changes and additions added by Phil Rynda, former lead character designer and prop designer for "Adventure Time". Olson later related in an interview that she was impressed by her character because, "she has really cool style […] I love what they come up with [in] every episode." The episode also features the vocal talents of actor Erik Estrada as King Worm; Estrada would reprise the role for the eponymous fourth season episode "King Worm".\n', 'BULLET::::- Olivia Olson, young actress voice of Marceline on "Adventure Time"\n', 'Marceline the Vampire Queen is a fictional character in the American animated Cartoon Network television series "Adventure Time", created by Pendleton Ward. She is voiced by Olivia Olson in most appearances, by Ava Acres as a child and by Cloris Leachman as an old woman. Marceline is a fun-loving 1,000-year-old vampire queen, as well as a musician who plays an electric bass that she made from her family\'s heirloom battle-axe. The artistic design for Marceline was created by Ward, with small changes and additions added by Phil Rynda, former lead character and prop designer for "Adventure Time".\n', 'BULLET::::- "Adventure Time" – Gridface Princess, Additional voices\n', 'In the American version, Olivia Olson, who is widely known as the voice of Marceline the Vampire Queen in "Adventure Time", voiced the character. South African musician Toya Delazy who is one of the many actors voicing the character in different countries expressed that she was intrigued by the character and felt a connection to her due to their similar backgrounds, as Delazy explained that she too missed out on getting to know her three sisters due to being estranged from her father for many years. Alesha Dixon who voiced Bliss for the British version expressed that she was beyond excited about her role and loved voicing character but that it was a hard job, explaining that this was due to the characters feisty personality and the fact that she had to do a lot of screaming while voicing her. She also stated that she watched the episode with her daughter Azura when it aired and that her daughter recognized her as the character. In the Arabic version the Fourth Powerpuff Girl is voiced by Nancy Ajram, a prominent Lebanese singer.\n', 'Reeve provided the bass guitar sound for the character Marceline the Vampire Queen in the Cartoon Network show Adventure Time.\n', 'BULLET::::- "Adventure Time" - voice of Bryce (2015-2017)\n', 'In June 2015, Moe along with rapper Open Mike Eagle, launched "Conversation Parade", a podcast in which the two discuss the Cartoon Network animated series "Adventure Time". The podcast has featured guests like Jeremy Shada (the voice of Finn the Human), John DiMaggio (the voice of Jake the Dog), Hynden Walch (the voice of Princess Bubblegum), Adam Muto (the series\' co-executive producer and showrunner), Kent Osborne ("Adventure Time"s head writer), Niki Yang (the voice of BMO and Lady Rainicorn), Olivia Olson (the voice of Marceline), Jesse Moynihan (former storyboard artist), Jessica DiCicco (the voice of Flame Princess), Elizabeth Ito (one of the show\'s supervising directors), and alternative country musician Neko Case.\n', 'BULLET::::- Jeremy Shada, voice actor ("Adventure Time")\n']

question_info.question: who does the voice of marceline on adventure time
passages:
Marceline is voiced by Olivia Olson. When production on "Adventure Time" began, Ward contacted his friend Martin Olson, who was a writer on the animated Disney series "Phineas and Ferb", and asked if he knew who played the character Vanessa Doofenshmirtz on "Phineas and Ferb", as he wanted "her as a voice" on his show; reportedly, Ward was unaware that the actress was actually Martin Olson's daughter. During the casting audition, Olivia Olson first read for Princess Bubblegum, but was later asked to read for the role of Marceline. Upon seeing character designs, Olson was "definitely impressed by the character". Because Ward knew that he wanted Olivia on his show, Martin Olson later joked that her audition was simply a "sham" to please network executives. In order to get into character, Olson often dresses in a manner similar to Marceline when she records her lines; she explained, "I always find ... that on the days that I go in to record Marceline, I'll dress like her, in a weird way ... I'll throw on some rock n' roll boots, maybe some red lipstick, and just go in there." In flashback sequences, younger Marceline is voiced by Ava Acres. In the fifth season episodes "Finn the Human" / "Jake the Dog", an older, alternate universe version of the character is voiced by Cloris Leachman. Martin Olson also provides the voice for Marceline's demonic father Hunson Abadeer. Olivia Olson later noted that the opportunity to voice act with her father was "pretty cool".
Marceline is voiced by Olivia Olson; she had originally auditioned for the role of Princess Bubblegum. After her initial audition, she was asked to read for the role of Marcelline, and was "definitely impressed by the character" after seeing design drawings. Olson is also the character's singing voice. The artistic design for Marceline was created by Ward, with small changes and additions added by Phil Rynda, former lead character designer and prop designer for "Adventure Time". Olson later related in an interview that she was impressed by her character because, "she has really cool style […] I love what they come up with [in] every episode." The episode also features the vocal talents of actor Erik Estrada as King Worm; Estrada would reprise the role for the eponymous fourth season episode "King Worm".
BULLET::::- Olivia Olson, young actress voice of Marceline on "Adventure Time"
Marceline the Vampire Queen is a fictional character in the American animated Cartoon Network television series "Adventure Time", created by Pendleton Ward. She is voiced by Olivia Olson in most appearances, by Ava Acres as a child and by Cloris Leachman as an old woman. Marceline is a fun-loving 1,000-year-old vampire queen, as well as a musician who plays an electric bass that she made from her family's heirloom battle-axe. The artistic design for Marceline was created by Ward, with small changes and additions added by Phil Rynda, former lead character and prop designer for "Adventure Time".
BULLET::::- "Adventure Time" – Gridface Princess, Additional voices
In the American version, Olivia Olson, who is widely known as the voice of Marceline the Vampire Queen in "Adventure Time", voiced the character. South African musician Toya Delazy who is one of the many actors voicing the character in different countries expressed that she was intrigued by the character and felt a connection to her due to their similar backgrounds, as Delazy explained that she too missed out on getting to know her three sisters due to being estranged from her father for many years. Alesha Dixon who voiced Bliss for the British version expressed that she was beyond excited about her role and loved voicing character but that it was a hard job, explaining that this was due to the characters feisty personality and the fact that she had to do a lot of screaming while voicing her. She also stated that she watched the episode with her daughter Azura when it aired and that her daughter recognized her as the character. In the Arabic version the Fourth Powerpuff Girl is voiced by Nancy Ajram, a prominent Lebanese singer.
Reeve provided the bass guitar sound for the character Marceline the Vampire Queen in the Cartoon Network show Adventure Time.
BULLET::::- "Adventure Time" - voice of Bryce (2015-2017)
In June 2015, Moe along with rapper Open Mike Eagle, launched "Conversation Parade", a podcast in which the two discuss the Cartoon Network animated series "Adventure Time". The podcast has featured guests like Jeremy Shada (the voice of Finn the Human), John DiMaggio (the voice of Jake the Dog), Hynden Walch (the voice of Princess Bubblegum), Adam Muto (the series' co-executive producer and showrunner), Kent Osborne ("Adventure Time"s head writer), Niki Yang (the voice of BMO and Lady Rainicorn), Olivia Olson (the voice of Marceline), Jesse Moynihan (former storyboard artist), Jessica DiCicco (the voice of Flame Princess), Elizabeth Ito (one of the show's supervising directors), and alternative country musician Neko Case.
BULLET::::- Jeremy Shada, voice actor ("Adventure Time")
